sect1.title: Positions vacant
sect1.para: The following positions are currently vacant on the FlyMine project

sect2.title: Computer Officer Grade II (Software Development)
sect2.para: We are looking for a software developer with a background in biology to join a small team working on a project that seeks to integrate functional genomics data from the model organisms Drosophila melanogaster and Anopheles gambiae, using data generated by high throughput laboratory activity in the department and worldwide.

We are building a web application and associated infrastructure that will enable researchers to perform complex queries over a wide range of genomic and proteomic data sources, containing many terabytes of data between them. We are using Java and XML with a PostgreSQL backend, in a Linux/Unix environment, and making use of existing open source tools and libraries where possible. All our code is freely available under an open source licence. As a team, the software developers are responsible for gathering requirements, designing, coding and testing the system, many parts of which are technically challenging. Further details of the project can be found at .

You will be heavily involved with the data, data model and dataflow aspects of the system. You should have a background in the biological sciences and be familiar with biological data sources and the modelling and analysis of biological data, including the use of ontologies. You should also have at least one year's experience of software development in Java and any experience in using XML or SQL/OQL would be an advantage.
* Funds for this post are available until 30 April 2005 in the first instance, and the post may, subject to availability of funding, be renewed for a further period or periods.

Informal enquiries to Dr. Andrew Varley: ajv12@cam.ac.uk. Applications, to include a PD18 cover sheet, full CV and details of three referees, should be addressed to Miss Marie Chambers, Department of Genetics, University of Cambridge, Downing Street, Cambridge, CB2 3EH, tel: (01223) 333 999, e-mail: mc371@gen.cam.ac.uk.
The closing date for applications is 31 October 2003.
